name: CameraHeading
description: Camera Type

name: cameraType
description:
The type of camera you are using. RPi includes the HD and compatible cameras.
You must set and change the camera here, not in config.sh.
label: Camera Type

name: cameraModel
description: The model of camera you are using.  Cannot be changed here.
label: Camera Model

name: daytimeSettingsHeader
description: Daytime settings

name: takeDaytimeImages
description: Activate to take daytime images.
label: Daytime Capture

name: saveDaytimeImages
description:
Activate to save daytime images.
Only applies if Daytime Capture is enabled.
label: Daytime Save

name: dayautoexposure
description: Activate to enable daytime auto-exposure.
label: Auto-Exposure

name: daymaxautoexposure
description:
Maximum daytime Auto-Exposure time in milliseconds (1000ms = 1 sec).
Only applies if daytime Auto-Exposure is enabled.
label: Max Auto-Exposure

name: dayexposure
description:
Manual exposure time in milliseconds. Can be a fraction.
If using daytime Auto-Exposure, this number is used as a starting point.
label: Manual Exposure

name: daymean
description:
The target mean brightness level when Auto-Exposure is on. 1.0 is pure white.
Best used when Auto-Exposure and Auto-Gain are on.
0 disables this auto-exposure mode.
label: Mean Target

name: daybrightness
description:
Changes the amount of light in the image.
Higher values are brighter.
label: Brightness

name: daysaturation
description:
Changes the saturation level of the image.
The lowest level produces a black and white image.
label: Saturation

name: daycontrast
description: Changes the contrast of an image.
label: Contrast

name: daydelay
description: Delay between daytime images in milliseconds.
label: Delay

name: dayautogain
description: Activate to enable dayime Auto-Gain.
label: Auto-Gain

name: daymaxautogain
description: Maximum gain when using Auto-Gain.
label: Max Auto-Gain

name: daygain
description:
Manually sets the light sensitivity of the camera.
A high value returns a brighter image but more noise too.
label: Gain

name: daybin
description: Binning level. 1x1 = binning OFF.
label: Binning

name: dayawb
description: Sets Auto White Balance.
label: Auto White Balance

name: dayawbmode
description: When using Auto White Balance, this option sets the AWB algorithm into the named AWB mode.
label: Auto White Balance Mode

name: daywbr
description:
Red component for the white balance.
When using Auto White Balance, this number is a starting point.
label: Red Balance

name: daywbb
description:
Blue component for the white balance.
When using Auto White Balance, this number is a starting point.
label: Blue Balance

name: dayskipframes
description:
When starting Allsky during the day, skip up to this many frames while the software gets to the correct exposure.
Only applies if daytime Auto-Exposure is on.
label: Frames To Skip

name: dayTuningFile
description:
Name of the day camera tuning file to use. Omit this option to preserve the default behavior of libcamera.
Please read this documentation or this document if using a Raspberry camera with libcamera. For other Raspberry cameras read the camera manual for more information.
label: Tuning File

name: nighttimeSettingsHeader
description: Nighttime settings

name: nightautoexposure
description: Activate to enable nighttime auto-exposure.
label: Auto-Exposure

name: nightmaxautoexposure
description:
Maximum nighttime Auto-Exposure time in milliseconds.
Only applies if nighttime Auto-Exposure is enabled.
label: Max Auto-Exposure

name: nightexposure
description:
Manual exposure time in milliseconds. Can be a fraction.
If using nighttime Auto-Exposure, this number is used as a starting point.
label: Manual Exposure

name: nightmean
description:
The target mean brightness level when Auto-Exposure is on. 1.0 is pure white.
Best used when Auto-Exposure and Auto-Gain are on.
0 disables this auto-exposure mode.
label: Mean Target

name: nightbrightness
description:
Changes the amount of light in the image.
Higher values are brighter.
label: Brightness

name: nightsaturation
description:
Changes the saturation level of the image.
The lowest level produces a black and white image.
label: Saturation

name: nightcontrast
description: Changes the contrast of an image.
label: Contrast

name: nightdelay
description: Delay between nighttime images in milliseconds.
label: Delay

name: nightautogain
description: Activate to enable nighttime Auto-Gain.
label: Auto-Gain

name: nightmaxautogain
description: Maximum gain when using Auto-Gain.
label: Max Auto-Gain

name: nightgain
description:
Manually sets the light sensitivity of the camera.
A high value returns a brighter image but more noise too.
label: Gain

name: nightbin
description: Binning level. 1x1 = binning OFF.
label: Binning

name: nightawb
description: Activate to enable Auto White Balance (camera adjusts color).
label: Auto White Balance

name: nightawbmode
description: When using Auto White Balance, this option sets the AWB algorithm into the named AWB mode.
label: Auto White Balance Mode

name: nightwbr
description:
Red component for the white balance.
When using Auto White Balance, this number is a starting point.
label: Red Balance

name: nightwbb
description:
Blue component for the white balance.
When using Auto White Balance, this number is a starting point.
label: Blue Balance

name: nightskipframes
description:
When starting Allsky at night, skip up to this many frames while the software gets to the correct exposure.
Only applies if nighttime Auto-Exposure is on.
label: Frames To Skip

name: nightTuningFile
description:
Name of the night camera tuning file to use. Omit this option to preserve the default behavior of libcamera.
Please read this documentation or this document if using a Raspberry camera with libcamera. For other Raspberry cameras read the camera manual for more information.
label: Tuning File

name: DayAndNightHeader
description: Both daytime and nighttime settings

name: config
description: Optional configuration file to use for settings.
label: Configuration File

name: sharpness
description:
Changes the sharpness of an image.
Too sharp and images look unnatural.
label: Sharpness

name: width
description: Image width in pixels. 0 = max sensor width.
label: Image Width

name: height
description: Image height in pixels. 0 = max sensor height.
label: Image Height

name: type
description:
'auto' uses color if possible, otherwise the best mono mode supported.
RAW16 only works with PNG extension.
label: Image Type

name: quality
description:
Range for a PNG image: 0-9. Range for a JPG image: 0-100.
Higher numbers produce larger, clearer files.
label: Quality

name: meanthreshold
description: When using Mean Target this specifies how close to the target the brightness should be.
label: Mean Threshold

name: filename
description:
Extensions allowed: .jpg or .png.
WARNING: saving a .png file can take 10 or more seconds so be sure the time between successive images is long enough. To measure how long it takes your Pi to save a .png file, set the Debug Level to 3 and look in the log file.
label: Filename

name: flushImmediately
description: If activated then output files to be flushed to disk as soon as every frame is written, rather than waiting for the system to do it.
label: Flush output files immediately

name: rotation
description: Set image rotation to enable proper orientation.
label: Rotation

name: flip
description: Select a flipping option if you want to reverse the image along an axis.
label: Flip

name: notificationimages
description:
Activate to display notification images, e.g., 'Camera is off during the day'.
While these messages appear in the WebUI and Allsky Website, they are not saved so don't appear in timelapse, startrails, or keograms.
label: Notification Images

name: consistentDelays
description:
Activate to have the delays between images be of consistent length.
The time between the start of exposures will always be (max exposure + delay).
label: Consistent Delays Between Images

name: latitude
description: Latitude of the camera. Can be a number (-90 to 90) or a positive number with direction (N or S), for example: 60.7N.
label: Latitude

name: longitude
description: Longitude of the camera. Can be a number (-180 to 180) or a positive number with a direction (E or W), for example: 135.05W.
label: Longitude

name: angle
description: Altitude of the Sun in degrees relative to the horizon at which to switch between day and night.
label: Angle

name: takeDarkFrames
description:
Activate to capture dark frames, which are used to decrease noise. This mode hides text and time overlays.
Will continually take dark frames until restarted.
label: Take Dark Frames

name: useDarkFrames
description: This enables dark frame subtraction, assuming you have dark frames.
label: Use Dark Frames

name: locale
description:
Your locale, used to determine what the thousands and decimal separators are.
Type 'locale' at a command prompt to see your choices (use the LC_NUMERIC entry).
label: Locale

name: debuglevel
description: Debug level. 0 is errors only.
label: Debug Level

name: useLogin
description:
Determines if you need to login to the WebUI or not.
If your Pi is accessible on the Internet, do NOT turn this off!!.
label: Require WebUI Login

name: alwaysshowadvanced
description: Activate to always show the advanced options.
label: Always Show Advanced

name: overlayHeader
description: Image overlay settings

name: externalOverlay
description:
Choose how to have image overlays done.
module has more features and is very flexible.
When set to module, the overlay settings below do NOT apply.
label: Overlay Method

name: showTime
description: Activate to display the time an image was taken on the overlay.
label: Show Time

name: timeformat
description: Determines the format of the displayed time. Run 'man 3 strftime' to see the options.
label: Time Format

name: showTemp
description: Activate to display the camera sensor temperature on the overlay.
label: Show Temperature

name: temptype
description: Unit(s) to display temperature in.
label: Temperature Units

name: showExposure
description:
Activate to display the exposure length on the overlay.
If Auto-Exposure is set, '(auto)' will appear after the exposure time.
label: Show Exposure

name: showGain
description:
Activate to display the camera gain on the overlay.
If Auto-Gain is set, '(auto)' will appear after the gain value.
label: Show Gain

name: showBrightness
description: Activate to display the Brightness value you set on the overlay.
label: Show Brightness

name: showMean
description: Activate to display the calculated mean image brightness on the overlay.
label: Show Mean Brightness

name: showFocus
description:
Activate to display a focus metric to help you focus the camera.
This is only usefull while focusing.
label: Show Focus Metric

name: showMode
description: Activate to display the current mode day or night.
label: Show Mode

name: showCompass
description: Activate to display a compass image on the overlay.
label: Show Compass

name: text
description: Text that appears below the optional time with the same color and size.
label: Text Overlay

name: extratext
description:
Extra Text File (enter full path to the file).
Leave blank if NOT using an extra text file.
label: Extra Text File

name: extratextage
description:
The maximum age of the Extra Text File in seconds.
After this time the contents of the file will no longer be displayed. Set to 0 to always display.
label: Max Age Of Extra

name: textlineheight
description: The line height of the text in pixels. If increasing the font size causes the text to overlap then increase this value.
label: Line Height

name: textx
description: Text will begin this many pixels from the left.
label: Text X

name: texty
description: Text will begin this many pixels from the top.
label: Text Y

name: fontname
description: Font name for the text overlay. Used for both large and small text.
label: Font Name

name: fontcolor
description:
Blue, Green, and Red (BGR) values of text color.
NOTE: When using RAW 16 only the first two values are used i.e., 255 128 0.
label: Font Color

name: smallfontcolor
description:
BGR value of text color.
NOTE: When using RAW 16 only the first two values are used i.e., 255 128 0.
label: Small Font Color

name: fonttype
description: Choose between smooth font lines (antialiased), 8-pixel, or 4 pixel connectivity (harder edges).
label: Font Smoothness

name: fontsize
description: Text Font Size. The time, if displayed, will use this size; other text displayed will be about 20% smaller.
label: Font Size

name: fontline
description: How thick the text line should be.
label: Font Weight

name: outlinefont
description: Adds a black outline to the text overlay to improve contrast.
label: Use Outline Font

name: AllskyMapHeader
description: Allsky Map and Website Settings

name: displaySettings
description: Activate to add a link to the Allsky Website to display the settings on this page.
label: Display Settings

name: showonmap
description: Activate to have your camera appear on the Allsky Map.
label: Show on Map

name: websiteurl
description:
The URL of your Allsky Website, for example: https://www.thomasjacquin.com/allsky.
If your camera is not accessible on the Internet, leave this field empty.
Must begin with http or https.
label: Website URL

name: imageurl
description:
The URL of the image on your Allsky Website, for example: https://wwww.thomasjacquin.com/allsky/image.jpg.
Right-click on the image and select Copy Image Address.
If your camera is not accessible on the Internet, leave this field empty.
Must begin with http or https.
label: Image URL

name: location
description:
The location of your camera, for example: Whitehorse, YT.
No need to enter country since it'll be obvious looking at the map.
This setting and the remaining ones also appear on the Allsky Website, if installed.
label: Location

name: owner
description: The owner of the camera. It can be your name or an association or observatory, etc.
label: Owner

name: camera
description: The type and model of your camera, for example: ZWO 224MC or RPi HQ.
label: Camera

name: lens
description: The lens you're using on your camera, for example: <span class='WebUIValue'>Arecont 1.55<span>.
label: Lens

name: computer
description: The computer running your allsky camera, for example: Raspberry Pi 3, 4 GB.
label: Computer
